1gz16aax.title: Diagnosis by ultrasonography and CT scan in orbital vascular tumors and malformations]
1gz16aax.abstract: To analyze the value of ultrasonography (standardized A/B scan) and CT scan in the diagnosis of orbital vascular tumors and vascular malformations.One hundred and eight cases of orbital vascular tumors and malformations were studied, including 98 cases examined by ultrasonography, 108 cases examined by CT scan and 94 cases studied by orbital operation and pathological examination. There were 54 cases of cavernous hemangioma, 26 cases of varix, 13 cases of venous hemangioma, 6 cases of lymphangioma, 5 cases of infantile hemangioma and 4 cases of others disorders.The tumor could be detected in ultrasonography in 96/98 cases (98%), the false negative rate of ultrasonography was 2% (2/98). The nature of the tumor could be determined by ultrasonography in 93% (91/98) cases pre-operatively. The tumor could be found by CT in all cases (108/108). The nature of the tumor could be determined by CT in 92% (99/108) cases pre-operatively.Combined ultrasonography with CT scan can estimate the nature, extent and location of orbital vascular tumors and malformations and can be useful for selection of the route of orbital operation.

Tys6T8jH.title: Ophthalmological clinical findings of sphenoid ridge meningioma
Tys6T8jH.abstract: Objective To investigate the clinical and radiographic features of sphenoid ridge meningioma.Methods A retrospective review of all the cases of sphenoid ridge meningioma at Armed Police General Hospital of Beijing from October 1,2000 to October 1,2007 identified 49 patients by X-ray,computed tomography(CT),magnetic resonance imaging(MRI)and ultrasound examination.Forty-seven cases were diagnosed and verified by operation and pathology.Two patients were treated by γ knife.The follow-up period was 5 years.Results The proptosis was found in all of cases(100%).Thirty-two cases(65.3%)appeared restriction of eye movement,and 21 cases(42.8%)showed edema and congestion in eyelid and conjunctiva.Papilledema was seen in 13 cases(26.5%),and optico-ciliary vein was seen in 4 cases(8.1%).Twenty-nine patients firstly visited ophthalmologist,and 20 patients visited neurologist firstly.Sphenoid ridge meningioma was frequently misdiagnosed as fibrous dysplasia and inflammatory pseudotumor.Marked hyperostotic changes in sphenoid ridge and the abnormal signal intensity area by the orbital cavity were shown in CT.T1-weighted and T2-weighted axial MRI scan showed hyperostotic changes of spheroid bone.Dolinium-enhanced T1-weighted axial MRI fat-suppressed scan showed extension of sphenoorbital meningioma.Conclusion Sphenoid ridge meningioma are easily misdiagnosed in department of ophthalmology.Enhance MRI imaging could contribute veliability device to diagnosis.Proptosis,loss of visual acuity and oculomotor nerve palsy are important clinical features of meningioma.Conjunctival edema is significant clinical features.

62EQS5OH.title: The features of pathology and immunohistochemistry in orbital meningiomas]
62EQS5OH.abstract: To study the biological characteristics of orbital meningiomas using histological and immunohistochemistrical analysis.19 specimens taking from orbital meningiomas were included in the study. HE staining was used for histology analysis and the immunohistochemistry was applied to demonstrate the expression of Vimentin, EMA, Ki-67, p53 in the tissue of orbital meningiomas.The main configuration of orbital meningiomas was meningothelial, transitional and fibrous meningioma. The expression rations of Vimentin and EMA were 94.75% (18/19), 52.63% (10/19), respectively. The detected rations of Ki-67 and p53 were very lower.Our study shows that the major histological configuration of orbital meningiomas are meningothelial, transitional and fibrous meningioma. Compare with intracranial meningiomas, the expression rate of EMA in orbital meningiomas is lower. No difference of the expression rates of p53 and Ki-67 are found in benignant, recrudescent and malignant of tumor.

5eQZMlQF.title: Clinical analysis of optic nerve sheath meningiomas in 50 cases
5eQZMlQF.abstract: Objective To investigate the clinical manifestation,imaging characters and therapeutic principle of optic nerve sheath meningiomas to get a better clinical effect.Methods Fifty cases(53 eyes)with optic nerve sheath meningioma from June 1999 to May 2006 were studied retrospectively.Clinical data of all cases,standard A/B ultrasonography scanning,color doppler flow imaging,imaging of CT and MRI,treatments and surgical procedures were reviewed.Results Optic nerve sheath meningioma were seen mostly in middle-aged females.Patients typically presented with visual loss,exophthalmos,optic chronic edematous atrophy and optic ciliary veins with examination of fundus.There were significant appearances with standard A/B ultrasonography and CT,which indicated that optic nerve became thicker and lump was found at orbital soft tissue.MRI had a better effect on observing extension in optic canal and at intracalvarium.The therapeutic principles included observation,radiotherapy,exairesis or it combined with radiotherapy.Conclusion Optic nerve sheath meningiomas is a common tumor of orbit,and difficult to diagnosis correctly at early stage,but can be differentiated and diagnosed with imaging.Pathological location,size,scope,aggravation and specific situation of patients should be considered to do individualized treatment after final diagnosis.

b7T5BUrf.title: Clinical analysis of 436 patients with orbital fracture
b7T5BUrf.abstract: Objective For improving cognitive level about the orbital fracture,the clinical feature of patients troubled with it would be reviewed and summarized. Methods Practice has been put into retrospective analysis of the preoperative etiopathogenisis,clinical feature,visiting time,fractured type,operative time and method in 436 patients(448 eyes) with the orbital fracture.Simultaneously,retrospective appraisal of the postoperative effect was aimed directly at this trauma. Results There were totally 305 cases(317 eyes) blow-out fractures(69.95%),4 cases(4 eyes) invaginating fractures(0.92%),127 cases(127 eyes) complex fractures (29.13%).Mean eyesight of the preoperative was about 0.691±0.022; that of the postoperative about 0.676+0.030.Eyesight change of the preoperative was hardly different from that of the postoperative(P>0.05).And 220 cases with diplopia,114 cases were cured(51.82%): 52 casas were improved(23.64%): effective rate was 75.46%,171cases(178 eyes) with visual loss(39.22%),265 cases(270 eyes) without visual problem((60.78%).) Mean degree of eyeball invaginate at the preoperative was about 2.727±0.352 mm;that of the postoperative about(2.615±0.368 mm.)There existed in evident improvement between the preoperative and postoperative. Conclusions Prognosis of the orbital fracture is closely related with corresponding items in the above-mentioned methods.

Sf7AZGok.title: Design and construction of database system of orbital diseases
Sf7AZGok.abstract: Objective To design and develop professional database system of orbital diseases,thereby improving the management of clinical data and the ability of scientific research.Methods The Browser/server database structure was applied.The database platform was constructed by using Postgre SQL8.3.The database management system was established with Ruby1.8.6.We designed six functional modules,which were information input,case browser,case search,follow-up by messages,subscription of registration, user management.Results Varied clinical data of patients with orbital diseases were collected completely by using the database system. The data could be shared and preserved safely.The functional modules ran smoothly.Conclusions The system has satisfactory stability,security,compatibility and evident specialized characteristics,which is beneficial not only to information management of case records but also to clinical,teaching and research work.

doKJg90r.title: Chemoreduction treatment in retinoblastoma
doKJg90r.abstract: Objective To evaluate the efficacy of chemoreduction in the neoadjuvant of retinoblastoma.Methods A retrospective pilot study was performed to assess the effectiveness of 6 cyclial chemoreduction regimen of vincristine sulfate,etoposide and carboplatin in patients with retinoblastoma.The study included 23 patients with 41 tumors in 28 eyes.Results At the initial examination,the mean tumor base was 12.46 mm and the thickness was 8.6 mm.The secondum retinal detachment was present in 22 eyes.After 6 cyclial chemoreduction treatment,all tumors showed regression in size and visible evidence of calcification,the mean tumor base was 6.85 mm and the thickness was 3.72 mm.Overall,there was a mean 43.6% decrease in base and 56.7% decrease in thickness of the tumor at the end of the treatment period.The subretinal fluid was resolved completely,leaving flat retina in 20 eyes.Short-term systemic toxic effects were mild.Other local treatments could be made after chemoreduction.Conclusion Chemoreduction treatme-nt can lead to tumor shrinkage and be combined with other invasive treatments,such as cryotherapy,laser photocoagulation,thermotherapy,or plaque radiotherapy,which avoid the eyeball enucleation and external radiotherapy.

dI4vq1K1.title: Screening for differentially expressed genes between adenoid cystic carcinoma and normal lacrimal gland by genechip
dI4vq1K1.abstract: Objective To screen for the differentially expressed genes between lacrimal gland adenoid cystic carcinoma(ACC) and normal lacrimal gland tissues by gene chip,and to analyze their biological information.Methods Five patients with ACC and 5 controls were included,the cRNA probes prepared from total RNA were hybridized with two Human OneArray chips,including 30968 known human genes,and the signals were scanned by the Axon GenePix 4000B scanner.The differentially expressed genes were screened by bioinformatics.Results Compared with the gene expression profile of normal lacrimal glands,1 103 genes were significantly up-regulated and 1 001 were significantly down-regulated in ACC.These genes were associated with cellular metabolism and regulation,cellular communication and localization,cell cycle and so on.The search results from the database of the Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes showed these up-regulated genes related with the functions of focal adhesion,cell communication and extracellular matrix-receptor interaction,et al.Those down-regulated genes were involved in MAPK signaling pathway and Toll-like receptor signaling pathway,et al.Conclusions The genechip is a powerful method in exploring the differentially expressed genes.Further analysis will help us to understand the molecular mechanism of ACC and discover new therapic target points.

n6ojaZ2f.title: Study of Microsurgical Treatment of Cranio-Orbital Tumors
n6ojaZ2f.abstract: Objective To explore the clinical characteristics of cranio-orbital tumors and microsurgical technique to treat them. Methods Thirty-five patients with cranio-orbital tumors were treated by microsurgery through subfronto-epidural approach, fronto-orbito-zygomatico-temporal approach, supraorbital-pterional approach, pterional approach and modified pterional approach respectively. The intracranial parts of the tumors were removed, and then orbitae were opened to resect intraorbital parts of the tumors. Results Of 35 patients with cranio-orbital tumors, 29 received the total resection of the tumors (82.9%), 4 subtotal resection and 2 part resection. Conclusions Microsurgerical resection is the best metod to treat cranio-orbital tumors. The operative approach is highly important for the successful resection of the cranio-orbital tumors.

l1zqwPVL.title: Ultrastructure of adenoid cystic carcinoma of lacrimal gland
l1zqwPVL.abstract: Objective To determine relationship between changes of tumor basement membrane(BM)and pathological types by observing the ultrastructure of adenoid cystic carcinoma(ACC)of lacrimal gland and normal lacrimal gland.Methods Materials for electron microscopy were obtained from 6 cases with ACC and normal lacrimal gland respectively.The ultrastructural features and changes of BM in different histologic patterns were focused.Results The alveolus of normal lacrimal gland was made of myoepithelial and epithelioglandular cells,which were lined by homogeneous BM.The cells with cruciform or tubular type were poor aligned.The irregular clumps of chromatin could be observed.The BM showed obvious thickening,multi-layered and reticular structure.Pseudopodia of tumor cells were seen infiltrating into BM and making it discontinuation and dissolution.The massive dissolved extracellular matrix was revealed in the intercellular space of solid pattern.The intact BM was unusual.Conclusions The thickening and structural disorder of BM are important features of ACC,dissolution and discontinuation of which could be the evidence of tumor invasive growth.More findings may serve as one of the explanations on invasion and metastasis mechanism of ACC.It will be a new target point of therapy or delayed invasion of ACC that degradation of BM is prevented or activity of the related enzyme is decreased.

2FkrVuJC.title: Patterns and Multiple Factors of Visual Field Changes in Patients of Orbital Tumors
2FkrVuJC.abstract: Objective To summarize patterns and related factors of visual field changes in patients of orbital tumors.Methods The static central visual fields were tested by Humphrey 720i automated perimeter in patients of orbital tumors.The statistics were analyzed.Results The effects of location(in the middle or in the puncta of tumors on general reduction between groups have significant differences.Tumors in interior side of optic nerve show no significant difference on thresholds between four quadrants.However,the other three show significant differences.The directions of compression of optic nerve have no significant difference on thresholds between four quadrants.Compression of the posterior wall and location in the obit may both cause the descending of mean defect and pattern standard deviation.But the latter have more significant effects.Mean defects(MD) have no significant difference between tumors in the middle of the orbit and in the puncta,but pattern standard deviation(PSD) do.The follow-up analysis show visual defects are reversible.Conclusions General reduction can be caused by tumors in puncta.Tumors in puncta lead to visual defects more frequently.Compression of optic nerve may descend thresholds in four quadrants.No significant corresponding relations showed between directions of compression and four quadrants.

AwPZnZvV.title: Clinical characterization of severe orbital complications after endoscopic sinus surgery]
AwPZnZvV.abstract: To summarize the clinical feature of severe orbital complications after endoscopic sinus surgery and to explore the precautions.A retrospective review study. Twenty-two cases of severe orbital complications after endoscopic sinus surgery between January 2002 and December 2012 were included. The main parameters for analyzing were history of paranasal sinuses, clinical manifestation of complications, imaging findings, site of injury, the relationship between injury site and clinical signs.Twenty-two cases of patients with serious complications, including: visual loss in 7 cases (32%), ptosis in 5 cases (23%), ocular position deviation in 15 cases (68%), limitation of ocular motility in 17 cases (77%), enophthalmos in 10 cases (45%). Imaging display: medial rectus involvement in 14 cases, inferior rectus involvement in 6 cases. The most common site of entry into the orbit was the medial orbital wall (14 cases, 64%), followed by the inferomedial wall (6 cases, 27%). Radiological imagings showed the medial displacement of optic nerve in 7 cases (32%) and foreign bodies in the orbit or paranasal sinuses in 8 cases (36%). Medical treatment was given in 1 cases and surgical repair in 9 cases. Removal of foreign bodies was performed in 6 cases. One patient received inferior rectus and orbital wall repair, but no improvement in ocular movement. Orbital reconstruction for endophthalmos was performed in two cases. The improvement was recorded only in one case.The most severe complication is vision loss and the most common complication is limitation of ocular motility and ocular position deviation. The most common site of injury was within the rectus muscle, often accompanied by the defect of inner wall. Except foreign bodies, other complications were difficult to treat with poor prognosis. Emphasis should be placed on prevention.

UezUAXyQ.title: Embolization treatment after direct surgical exposure for orbital varix: 5 cases report
UezUAXyQ.abstract: Objective To report the result of orbital varix with embolization treatment after direct surgical exposure.Design Case series.Participants 2 male and 3 female patients with orbital varix confirmed by clinical manifestations.Methods Patients with orbital varix were performed orbitotomy or direct puneture under general anesthesia.With the guide of X-ray contrast agent was injected to display the location and boundary of veins.After injection of embolizing agent GLUBRAN2 0.6-1.4ml,the venous volume was evaluated until the veins did not dilate with pressure on necks.Main Outcome Measures Visual acuity,ocular movement and exophthalmos. Results The abnormal veins of 3 patients were embolized completely without enophthalmos or exophthalmos after pressure on the neck. Symptoms of the other 2 patients were improved with a few residual veins.Conclusions The embolization after direct surgical exposure is a safe and effective treatment for orbital varix.(Ophthalmol CHN,2007,16:301-304)

3g6F7X0K.title: The clinicopathologic analysis of 22 cases of metastatic orbital tumors
3g6F7X0K.abstract: Objective To study the clinicopathologic characteristics and the primary position of metastatic orbital tumors.Design Retrospective case series.Participants Twenty-two patients with metastatic orbital tumor.Methods The clinical,imaging anti histopathological data of 22 patients with metastatic orbital tumors,treated in our hospital from 1999 to 2007 were reviewed.Main Outcome Measures The clinical,imaging and histopathological manifestations,the primary position of tumor.Results There were 6 cases(27.3%)arising from breast cancer,5 cases(22.7%)derived from lungs cancer,3 cases(13.6%)from unknown primary position with poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma,2 cases(9.1%)from liver cancer.The primary tumor was thyroid carcinoma,cervical carci- noma,rectal carcinoid,lower extremity malignant melanoma,retroperitoneal malignant paraganglioma,adrenal neuroblastoma in 1 ease each.There were 13 female patients and 9 male patients whose mean age at diagnosis was 50.2 years(median 51 years,ranged from 6 to 67 years older).In all 22 cases,11 cases with metastatic tumors was in right orbit,5 cases in left orbit,and 1 case in bilateral or- bits.Two cases were simultaneous in choroid and orbit,3 cases were orbito-cranial communicating tumors.The most frequent ocular signs were decreased visual acuity,exophthalmos,limited ocular movement,ocular pain and lid swelling.There was no history of malig- nant tumor at the time of presentation in 10 cases(45.5%).In 3 cases(13.6%),the primary tumor remained undetected despite systemic evaluation.Conclusions Most of the metastatic orbital tumors are from breast cancer;followed with lung cancer and tumor unknown primary position.Ocular signs are noted prior to diagnosis of the primary lesion in part of cases.(Ophthalmol CHN,2007,16:403-406)

4vZuoLPo.title: Megnetic resonance imaging findings of orbital schwannomas
4vZuoLPo.abstract: Objective To evaluate the diagnostic value of megnetic resonance imaging(MRI)and illustrate the common MRI features of orbital schwannoma.Methods Sixty-two consecutive cases of pathologically proved orbital schwannomas were retrospectively received.All patients were involved in unilateral eye and examined with T1-and T2-weighted images.The enhanced T1-weighted images were obtained after administration of gadopentetate dimeglumine.All MRI were analyzed and compared.Results In our study,the most common shape of lesions were cone-shaped(16 cases),dumbbell-shape(10 cases),oval(9 cases)and round(8 cases).The common sites of orbital schwannoma were the superior aspect of the orbit(17 cases),medial superior of the orbit(12 cases)and orbital apex(12 cases).On unenhanced T1-weighted MRI,53 of lesions showed isointense or with small patches of hypointense areas.The patterns of enhancement on T1-weighted correlated with the signal characteristics on T2-weighted images.There were 5 types and the most common sign was peripheral(ring)enhancement(18 cases).Lesions with homogeneous or heterogeneous enhancement were 16 cases and 26 cases,respectively.Conclusion MRI shows important diagnostic value for orbital schwannoma,especially after using contrast.MRI can distinctly display the location and shape of tumors.T1-weighted images are relatively nonspecific.T2-weighted and enhanced T1-weighted images suggest pathologic information of tumors.In paticular,peripheral enhancement should be a target sign of schwannomas.

YRTCpLUl.title: Innovation and improvement of the orbital diseases in China
YRTCpLUl.abstract: The orbit disease is a subject which is involved in multiple fields.We have made great progresses and innovations in the clinical study of orbital diseases in China.Especially we have developed new operative techniques and obtained good effects in treatment of the embolization of orbital varix after direct surgical exposure and the enbloc repairing for blow-out fractures of orbital walls.(Ophthalmol CHN,2007,16:363-364)

0fcGZkPs.title: Imaging investigation of orbital neurilemoma
0fcGZkPs.abstract: ObjectiveOrbital neurilemoma is common benign tumor in ophthalmology,and it is causing a increasing concern of ophthalmologist because it is difficult to make a definite diagnosis prior to operation.In present experiment,we evaluated the role of tomography(CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MR) in the diagnosis of orbital neurilemoma.MethodsCT and MR imaging of 42 patients with pathologically confirmed orbital neurilemomas were analyzed retrospectively.CT scanning was performed in all 42 patients and contrast scanning in 15 patients of them,and MR imaging was performed in 37 patients and contrast scanning in 35 patients of them.ResultsOf the 42 cases with orbital neurilemomas,tumors was located at superior orbit in 20 cases,lateral in 9 cases,inferior 11 cases and medial in 2 cases.Tumors were elongate-shape in 19 cases,round-like 8 cases,leaf-like 9 cases and dumb-bell 6 cases.CT scanning showed iso-density mass in 28 cases and heterogeneity in 14 cases,and 5 cases of later showed cystoid-like change.MR imaging displayed a identical T1 and a long T2 signal intensity weighted images in 4 cases,identical T1 and T2 mixing signal in 29 cases,identical T1 and T2 in 4 cases.After Gd-DTPA enhancement in 35 cases,heterogeneity enhancement of the mass was seen in 31 cases and obvious enhancement in 4 cases.Orbital-cranial communicating mass was found in 5 cases in all cases tested.ConclusionCT and MR imaging can determine the site,configuration,and characteristics of neurilemoma,and these imaging methods offer better evidence for diagnosis and treatment of tumor.MR imaging is superior to CT in the diagnosis of orbital neurilemoma.

M131AQQw.title: Retrospectively analysis of diagnosis and treatment of the orbital neurilemomas
M131AQQw.abstract: Objective: To evaluate the diagnosis and surgery of orbital neurilemoma. Methods: Thirty-eight patients with pathologically confirmed orbital neurilemomas were analyzed retrospectively. The age of the patients ranged from 9 years to 69 years. Twenty-three patients were female and fifteen were male. Standardized A/B scan was performed in 37 cases. CT scanning was performed in 38 patients with contrast scanning in 15 patients and MR imaging was performed in 33 patients with contrast scanning in 32 patients. Results: Neurilemoma was generally low to medium reflective or echo in the ultrasound. Of the 38 cases with orbital neurilemomas, location of tumors was superior of the orbit in 17 cases; lateral and inferior in 19 cases and medial in 2 cases. Shape of the tumors was elongate or round-like 26 cases, leaf-like and dumbbell 12 cases. CT scanning showed soft tissue high density mass in 32 cases, 6 cases were heterogeneity (for cystoid change). MR imaging in 33 patients displayed a identical T1 and a long T2 signal intensity weighted images in 4 cases; identical T1 and T2 mixed signal (short, identical and long signal) in 28 cases; identical T1 and T2 in 1 cases. After Gd-DTPA enhancement in 32 cases, heterogeneity enhancement of the mass was seen in 28 cases, marked enhancement 4 cases. Four cases in all cases was found orbital-cranial communicate mass. Surgical approach was lateral orbitotomy in 26 cases, combined lateral and medial orbitotomy in 2 cases, anterior orbitotomy 4 cases and medial orbitotomy in 2 cases. Conclusions: Modern medical imaging, especial MR imaging can demonstrate the site, configuration, and characteristics of the tumors and contribute to the diagnosis and treatment. Skill of surgery can improve the rate of success and decrease the complications.

TFVOZDGh.title: Observation of preadipocytes in the orbit of thyroid-associated ophthalmopathy membrane surface by atomic force microscopy
TFVOZDGh.abstract: Objective To investigate the difference of morphology of the preadipocytes in the orbit of normal human and thyroid-associated ophthalmopathy(TAO) patients by atomic force microscopy(AFM).Methods The morphology characteristic of membrane surface in orbital preadipocytes of TAO patients(observation group) and normal human(control group) were observed by AFM.Results The cells were long fusiform,and the cell diameter> 80 μm in the two groups when the scanning scope was 80 μm×80 μm,there was no evident difference.When the scanning scope was 1 μm×1 μm,the cells of two groups appeared many inequal of sizes granulo-material.The membrane surface of observation group were rougher,and the roughness was(36.480±8.146)nm.The membrane surface of control group were smoother,and the roughness was(32.189±7.819)nm.The cell membrane of observation group was obviously rougher than control group(t=4.342,P<0.05).Conclusion AFM can clearly and visually observe the micromechanism and 3D imaging of orbital preadipocytes membrane.AFM is a better instrument for observing the cell membrane morphous.

L8tCOYPS.title: Clinical pathologic observe of Orbital extraocular extension of choroidal melanoma
L8tCOYPS.abstract: [Objective] To summarize the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and pathological features of orbital extraocular extension of choroidal melanoma and find out the pathway of extend from the globe to the orbit. [Methods]Retrospective review of Clinical records and histopathology .Collect 12 cases which improve by histopathology, choroidal melanoma extension into the orbit ,review the feature of MRI single and observe all patient’s pathology slices, find the feature and the way of choroidal melanoma extend to the orbit. [Results]1. All patients received pre-operative magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), histopathology revealed that the tumor was composed of malignant melanoma cells. The typical sign of MRI demonstrating mass with high signal intensity in T1WI, with low signal intensity in T2WI.When tumor with plenty of melanin pigment showed the tipical sign, while less of melanin pigment show different sign. After enhanced MRI , tumor show high signal ,the reson was the tumor wealth to the blood supply, has no relationship with melanin pigment .2.Pathway of infiltration: ① invasion through posterior scleral emissary channels(permeation through scleral lamellae) and sclera vortex vein ②invade the optic nerve or its meninges③ infiltrate retina,ciliary body, iris and conjunctiva ④infiltrate nerve and muscle⑤tumor embolus in hematogenous metastasis. [Conclusions]Extraocular extension of choroidal melanoma can be better diagnosed with magnetic resonance imaging and has different pathologic ways to invade orbit.

FHtEXzj2.title: Histopathological features of adenoid cystic carcinoma of the lacrimal gland
FHtEXzj2.abstract: Objective To evaluate the histological features of adenoid cystic carcinoma(ACC) of the lacrimal gland and investigate the relationship between its histologic patterns and microscopic characteristics representing invasional behavior.Design Retrospective case series.Participants 49 specimens arised from larcrimal gland confirmed by pathology.Methods All specimens were categorized by the histologic patterns of WHO and were graded according to Szanto's method.Immunohistochemical stains using antibodies to S-100 and CD34 were employed.Main Outcome Measures The histological features of three patterns and the positive ratio of the characteristics which represented invasional behavior,including perineural infiltration,fat tissues and muscles invasion,tumor embolus in vessels.The positive ratio of the sign of perineural infiltration in patients with or without pain symptom.Results Histologically,ACC were categorized into three patterns:tubular,cribriform,and solid.19 tumors were gradeⅠ,9 were gradeⅡ,21 were gradeⅢ.S-100 and CD34 were markers of immunohistochemical stains for nerve fibers and vessel endothelium.There were 2 types of microscopical appearance of perineural invasion,which was observed in 22(45%) specimens,respectively 1 in gradeⅠ,6 in gradeⅡand 15 in gradeⅢ.This difference of gradeⅠvsⅡand gradeⅠvsⅢproved to be statistically significant(P=0.001,P=0.000).Fat tissue invasion were noted in 12 and muscles invasion in 7.These features in three grade groups had no statistic significant differences.Tumor embolus in vessels was observed in one case.The sign of perineural invasion was recorded in 47%(15/32) cases with pain symptom,while in 41% (7/17) cases without pain.Conclusions The proportion of gradeⅢis high in ACC of the lacrimal gland.Perineural invasion is one of the important invasion ways and characteristic histological features which is more frequent in high-grade cases.Fat tissue or muscles invasion and tumor embolus are uncommon in our cases.There is no correlation between pain symptom and perineural invasion under microscopy.

GTInmpBY.title: Clinical evaluation of episcleral plaque radiotherapy for retinoblastoma
GTInmpBY.abstract: Objective Retinoblastoma is the most important intraocular malignancy of childhood.The management of retinoblastoma has changed in recent years.This study evaluated the efficacy of episcleral plaque radiotherapy for the treatment of retinoblastoma.MethodsA review of episcleral plaque radiotherapy was used as a method of management in 18 eyes of 16 patients with retinoblastoma.In the 16 patients,phase Ⅰ-Ⅲ of tumors were in 4 eyes,and those of phase Ⅳ-Ⅴa were in 8 eyes and Vb phase in 6 eyes.125I plate was put in episcleral for 5-12 days dependent upon the radiological dose following the system chemotherapy.The follow-up periods was 3-24 months.ResultsThe tumor got control in 15 eyes(83%)after episcleral plaque radiotherapy,and 3 eyes with retinoblastoma were enucleated because of radiation complications and metastasis.Radiotherapy complications included cataract in 4 eyes(22%),neovascular glaucoma in 4 eyes(22%),vitreous hemorrhage in 3 eyes(16.7%).No any scleral necrosis was found during the follow-up.Recurrence and extraocular metastasis of retinoblastoma was seen in 1 eye.The systermic toxic effects of episcleral plaque radiotherapy were mild.Conclusion Episcleral plaque radiotherapy is a very effective method in treating retinoblastoma.

sgNhir3W.title: Diagnosis and treatment of orbit extramedullary plasmacytoma
sgNhir3W.abstract: Objective To evaluate clinical feature, diagnosis, and treatment of extrameduUary plasmacytoma (EMP) in the orbit. Design Retrospective case series. Participants 4 patients with EMP. Methods Clinical data of 4 patients with pathologically confirmed EMP in the orbit, treated in our hospital from July 2003 to December 2005 were reviewed. All of the patients underwent surgery plus adjuvant radiotherapy. Main Outcome Measures The clinical features, diagnosis and treatment of orbital EMP. Results The patients manifested mainly as exophthalmos, local masses and relevant symptoms. All of the patients received immunohistochemical staining, 2 were k type, and 2 were \ type. The plasma cell antibody of 3 patients showed masculine results. Four patients received Bence-Jones protein detection, all of them showed negative results. Bone marrow biopsy was made in 2 patients, and X ray film of chest survey was made in 4 patients, all results were normal. By the end of follow-up (June, 2006), there were no local recurrence and distant metastasis during average follow-up 24 months. Conclusion The diagnosis of EMP depends mainly on clinical manifestation and pathologic results and exclusion of multiple myeloma (MM). Surgery and radiotherapy are the main treatment for EMP in the orbit.

dGAhDoSU.title: Detection of Chlamydia immunofluorescence of ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases
dGAhDoSU.abstract: Objective To detect the rate of Chlamydia infection of ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases and to investigate the relativity between ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases and Chlamydial infection.Methods 118 patients with ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases were selected as experiment group,and 46 cases among them with mucosa associated lymphoid tissue(MALT) lymphoma,41 cases of hyperplasia of reactive lymphoid tissue,31 cases of other types of lymphoma.20 cases of samples with ocular adnexal non-lymphoproliferative diseases were selected as control group,including 17 cases of vascular tumor and 3 cases of thyroid associated ophthalmopathy.Then the method of immunofluorescence was used to detect the Chlamydia in two groups.It was positive when it showed over ten inclusionbodies in the vision of a high-rate magnification(×1 000).Otherwise it was negative.Results 80 cases of ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases in 118 cases had positive chlamydia infection(67.79%),while there was 0 case among 20 cases of ocular adnexal non-lymphoproliferative diseases in control group(χ2=32.262,P<0.001).There was no significant differecnce of pasitive rate of Chlamydia infection between MALT lymphoma patients and non-MALT lymphoma patients(P>0.05).Conclusion There might be a relationship between common ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases and Chlamydia infection,especially the MALT lymphoma and the hyperplasia of reactive lymphoid tissue have higher rates of Chlamydia infection.The detection and treatment of Chlamydia infection provide a new direction of research for the diagnosis and treatment of ocular adnexal lymphoproliferative diseases.

FS9VObNS.title: Diagnosis and treatment of orbit tuberculosis
FS9VObNS.abstract: Objective The clinical features of 9 patients with tuberculosis of orbit were evaluated to improve its diagnosis and treatment.Methods The clinical features,and diagnosis of 9 patients with tuberculosis of orbit after pathological biopsy were analyzed.Results The tuberculous lesion of orbit in all the 9 patients were excised and diagnosed by pathology.Conclusions There were no characteristic clinical manifestation in tuberculosis of orbit,which was easy to be misdiagnosed.Attention should be paid to the orbit tuberculosis.The diagnosis depends on pathology.

Mt3Xg8Gb.title: Clinical analysis of orbito-cranial communicating tumors
Mt3Xg8Gb.abstract: ObjectiveTo investigate the clinical features,pathological types and diagnostic methods of orbito-cranial communicating tumors.MethodsSixty cases of orbito-cranial communicating tumors confirmed by pathology examination were retrospectly studied.CT examination was performed in all cases and MRI was applied in 54 cases.Post-contrast MRI was curried and X-ray of optic canal in 42 cases and 20 cases respectively.ResultsThe most frequent symptoms included proptosis(58/60),increased orbital pressure(39/60) and visual acuity loss(36/60).The most common sign was headache(22/60).Meningomas(20/60),fibrous dysplasia(5/60) and metastasis carcinomas(5/60)were frequently seen in orbito-cranial communicating tumors.The imaging features in CT,MRI scan and X-ray were variable in the different kinds of orbito-cranial communicating tumors.Tumors communicated the orbit cavity and cranial cavity via optic canal,superior orbital fissure and skull walls.ConclusionIt is very helpful to combine clinical features and the application of imaging methods including CT,MRI and X-ray in the diagnosis and differential diagnosis of orbito-cranial communicating tumors.

ilHI9e40.title: Diagnosis of 130 cases with epithelial tumors of lacrimal gland
ilHI9e40.abstract: Objective: To analyse the clinical characteristics of 130 cases with epithelial tumors of lacrimal gland and identify the diagnosis. Design: Retrospective case series study. Participants: 130 cases with epithelial tumors of lacrimal gland. Methods: Clinical, imaging and histopathological data of 130 cases with tumors of lacrimal gland from Institute of Orbital Diseases, General Hospital of Chinese People's Armed Police Forces were analyzed. Main Outcome Measures: Clinical, imaging and histopathological manifestations. Results: The main clinical manifestations of epithelial tumors of lacrimal gland were ocular proptosis, vision degression, soreness and diplopia etc. The most common kind of benign tumor was pleomorphic adenoma (43.8%). The top three kinds of malignant tumors were adenoid cystic carcinoma (38.5%), pleomorphic adenocarcinoma (8.5%) and adenocarcinoma (3.8%). Each kind of the tumors has its special B scan, CT, MRI imaging characters. Conclusion: It is very important for primary diagnosis with a combination of clinical and imaging appearances, but the final diagnosis depends on the histopathological data.

wpyuG2Rt.title: The Clinical Application of Perimetry in Orbital Diseases
wpyuG2Rt.abstract: Visual field defects can occur in many kinds of orbital diseases,including optic nerve tumors,orbital tumors compressing optic nerves and thyroid associated ophthalmopathy.Orbital diseases may produce optic nerve injuries because of compression,infiltration or inflammation.Correspondingly,visual fields defects turn up.In addition,uniocular fields of fixation measurements may be used in thyroid associated ophthalmopathy to describe eye movements and restriction of extraocular muscles quantitatively.

moCQTNRf.title: The preliminary study of contrast-enhanced ultrasound patterns in orbital cavernous hemangioma
moCQTNRf.abstract: Objective To investigate patterns of contrast-enhanced ultrasound in orbital cavernous hemangioma.Methods The technique of ultrasound and contrast-enhanced ultrasound was used to analyze the enhancement patterns in 52 patients with orbital cavernous hemangioma.Results Forty-nine of 52 patients (49/52,94.23%)with orbital cavernous hemangiomas having typical enhancement,was observed with peripheral enhancement accompanied with some tiny globulars in the early phase,and subsequently these tiny globulars grew larger and larger. The peak intensity maintained a short time and then washed out slowly. Of all,rapidly uneven enhancement and rapidly washed out were shown in only 2 patients (2/52,3.85%),but no enhancement in others at all. Conclusion s Contrast-enhanced ultrasound of orbital cavernous hemangioma has typical enhancement pattern of "rolling snowball" ,and it is helpful for qualitative diagnosis.

Tppaa7zp.title: How to think about the postoperative recurrence of orbital tumors
Tppaa7zp.abstract: There are much more kinds of the orbital tumors, therapy is complex. The recurrence rate of some tumors is higher, the second or more orbital surgery are difficult, and the prognosis is bad. The reason of recurrence, methods of solving the recurrence of tumors, how to decrease the recurrence rate and improve the successful rate of orbital surgery are analyzed in this article.

2dX6o90o.title: Clinical analysis of orbital exenteration for orbital retinoblastoma]
2dX6o90o.abstract: To analyze the reasons of orbital exenteration for orbital retinoblastoma (RB) patients.Retrospective case series study. Clinical records were reviewed retrospectively of 17 orbital RB patients who had undergone exenteration from November 1999 to November 2010 at Armed Police General Hospital. The clinical records included ophthalmic history, process of diagnosis and treatment, symptom and signs, surgical approach, pathological diagnosis and follow-up results. The reasons of orbital exenteration for orbital RB patients according to medical history, process of diagnosis and treatment were analyzed.The average age of patient was 3.2 years old. The ratio of male versus female was 1.1: 1. The common clinical findings were as following: 11 cases of orbital mass, 7 cases of exophthalmos, 6 cases with palpebral edema, 4 cases of conjunctival congestion and edema with conjunctival mass, and 2 cases with orbital pain. Reasons for orbital exenteration were as following: 7 patients who lost the opportunity of the treatment because of concernning about the cost of treatment and poor prognosis and caused worst outcome. Exenteration had to be done eventually. Five cases of orbital recurrence happened after enucleation. Three patients' Rb invaded into orbit after conservative treatment intravenous chemotherapy or radio therapy alone. Two cases were misdiagnosed and mishandled causing rapidly tumor spread into the orbit.The major reasons of orbital exenteration for orbital RB patients lies in the following: giving up treatment from patients, tumor recurrence in the orbit after enucleation, progressing of orbital RB after simple conservative treatment, misdiagnosis and mishandling to let RB invade into orbit rapidly.

WA8iT4C0.title: Heparanase-1 and components of the hedgehog signalling pathway are increased in untreated alveolar orbital rhabdomyosarcoma.
WA8iT4C0.abstract: To assess the activities of heparanase-1 and elements of the hedgehog signalling pathway in alveolar orbital rhabdomyosarcoma.Specimens (n = 23) were divided into two groups, those from patients with preoperative chemoradiotherapy or untreated patients; six samples of normal extraocular muscle were used as a normal muscle group. The presence of heparanase-1, patched, smoothened and glioma-associated oncogene homologue-1 protein expression was determined in 23 cases of archival paraffin-embedded alveolar orbital rhabdomyosarcoma after immunohistochemistry. RNA was extracted from three groups of paraffin-embedded specimens and messenger RNA expressions of heparanase-1, smoothened and glioma-associated oncogene homologue-1 compared using nested reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction and a limiting dilution analysis.The heparanase-1, patched, smoothened and glioma-associated oncogene homologue-1 protein was expressed in 91.3%, 87.0%, 91.3% and 78.3%, respectively, of the alveolar orbital rhabdomyosarcoma specimens. Untreated rhabdomyosarcoma samples tended to stain intensely, but staining was relatively weak in tissue obtained from the chemoradiotherapy group. The expression levels of heparanase-1, smoothened and glioma-associated oncogene homologue-1 messenger RNA in untreated and chemoradiotherapy groups paralleled that seen with immunology, and there were no significant differences in heparanase-1, smoothened and glioma-associated oncogene homologue-1 messenger RNA levels between the chemoradiotherapy group and the normal muscle group (P > 0.05). However, the messenger RNA in the untreated group were all significantly higher than those in the chemoradiotherapy and normal muscle groups (P < 0.01).Both heparanase-1 and hedgehog signalling pathway are involved in the pathogenesis of alveolar orbital rhabdomyosarcoma; however, chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy appears to significantly inhibit their upregulation.

9Jnoc3gh.title: Modified orbital decompression for severe thyroid associated ophthalmopathy]
9Jnoc3gh.abstract: To present a new technique for orbital decompression that minimizes surgical approaches while maximizing the removed areas of orbital walls and to evaluate the efficacy and safety of it for patients with severe thyroid associated ophthalmopathy (TAO).A retrospective review of 40 cases (66 eyes) with severe TAO undergoing the modified decompression between January 2009 and January 2011 was conducted. All patients were assigned to three groups, which were group CON: compressive optic neuropathy in 30 eyes, group MP: marked proptosis in 30 eyes, and group EK: exposure keratopathy in 6 eyes. The deep lateral, medial walls and orbital floor decompressions were underwent via an eyelid crease or a lateral sub-brow S-shape approach with a transcaruncular approach. Clinical outcomes were recorded including visual acuity, exophthalmometry, diplopia, clinical activity score (CAS) and CT scans before and 6 months after surgery. Intra- and postoperative complications were recorded.The postoperative visual acuity was improved in 17 eyes (56.7%, P < 0.05) of group CON. The mean proptosis reduction was (8.1 ± 2.7) mm (t = 11.73, P < 0.01) and (11.4 ± 3.1) mm (t = 15.52, P < 0.01) in group CON and group MP, respectively. The CAS was decreased in group CON (P < 0.01). Compared with preoperative records, the degree of diplopia was not significantly different in group CON (U = 131.0, P = 0.309) and group MP (U = 157.5, P = 0.881). Diplopia resolved in 7 cases (39%) of group CON, 5 cases (28%) of group MP. New-onset diplopia or its aggravation was recorded in 3 cases (17%) of group CON, 4 cases (22%) of group MP. The other postoperative improvement included recovered color vision, reduced intraocular pressure, and healing keratopathy. The important complications were intraoperative dural tears, new-onset diplopia and ocular inferior displacement.The modified orbital decompression offers wide exposure to the three orbital walls, marked proptosis reduction, and no apparent scar. It is efficacious and safety for the treatment of CON and inflammatory activity of TAO without serious complications, meanwhile, has little risk of induced diplopia.

cWwBBDtY.title: Digital subtraction angiography diagnosis for pulsating exophthalmos and intravascular treatment
cWwBBDtY.abstract: Objective To evaluate the diagnosis of digital subtraction angiography (DSA) of cerebral arteries and the intravascular treatment for carotid cavernous fistula (CCF) mainly manifesting as pulsating exophthalmos. Methods Digital subtraction angiography (DSA) of cerebral arteries was carried out for 21 cases with pulsating exophthalmos. Detectable balloon and tungsten filament microcoil were used for intravascular embolism treatment in 16 cases. Results In the 20 patients , 10 cases were high flowing type of unilateral internal carotid artery(direct carotid cavernous fistula , direct CCF), and 10 cases were low flowing type (cavernous dural arteriovenous fistula ,CDAVF),and the other one was orbital tumor with abundant blood supply (the pathological classification was fibrous dysplasia of orbital bone). Clinical cure was obtained in 17 cases (among which 16 cases wnderment intravascular treatment, and 1 case wnderment Mata's test). The symptoms and signs disappeared after treatment.Conclusion Cerebral artery DSA and intravascular therapy are the ideal methods for diagnosis and treatment of CCF mainly manifesting as pulsating exophthalmos.

FotENUlv.title: Culture,differentiation identification of human orbital preadipocytes
FotENUlv.abstract: Objective Recent studies have shown that human orbital preadipocytes play an important part in many diseases.Our research is to establish a primary human orbital preadipocyte culturing method for the culture,induction,differentiation and identification of human orbital preadipocytes and gain a deeper insight into their biological traits.Methods We used the methods of tissue culture and enzyme digestion to obtain preadipocytes from the orbital adipose tissue of humans aged 18-56 years,and observed their morphology,proliferation and differentiation,followed by identification.Results Preadipocytes were successfully obtained by both the methods of tissue culture and enzyme digestion.Enzyme-digesting methods got purer and more preadipocytes,which were fusiform and grew in an "S" shape,with lipid droplets,positive on oil red O staining.Conclusion Human orbital preadipocytes can be differentiated into mature lipid-filled adiocytes.

caQK3moy.title: Imaging of orbital adenoid cystic carcinomas
caQK3moy.abstract: Objective To describe the imaging features of ultrasound,computer tomography(CT)and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)for orbital adenoid cystic carcinoma(ACC).Design Retrospective case series.Participants Thirty-eight cases of adenoid cystic carcinoma arising from larcrimal glands and 4 cases from accessory nasal cavities confirmed by histologic method.Methods The fea- tures of ultrasound,CT and MRI images of ACC patients were analyzed.Main Outcome Measures Images of standardized A-mode e- chography,B-ultrasound,CT and MRI.Results ACC had two types on standardized A-mode echography images:anterior high spikes with posterior low spikes;irregular high or low spikes.B-ultrasound could clearly display calcification,liquid cavities in the lesions.In our series,tumors were showed four shapes on CT images,which were fusiform,flat,block-shape and irregular shape.CT could sharply display the margin,the location of tumors and secondary osteoclasia as well as resorption.On T_(?)-weighted images ACC was showed isointensity,which displayed three types of intensity on T_2-weighted images,which were homogenous isointensity,iso-/hypointensity and iso-/hyperintensity.Majority of ACC were heterogeneously enhanced.The enhanced MRI contributed to displaying the extension paths of tumors.The extension paths of lacrimal gland ACC were varied.Accessory nasal cavities with ACC always involved ethmoidal and sphe- noidal sinus.Conclusion Ultrasound,CT and MRI can show differental features of orbital ACC.The level of diagnosis can be improved with the combined application of imaging methods.(Ophthalmol CHN,2007,16:391-394)

3lf6UhfS.title: Orbital exenteration in sixty-six patients
3lf6UhfS.abstract: Objective To analyze the indications and orbital reconstruction of exenteration.Methods Sixty-six cases with orbital exenteration were analyzed retrospectively.Clinical records,diagnosis,surgical procedures and orbital reconstruction were reviewed.Results Sixty-one cases were approached with total orbital exenteration,three cases with malignant melanoma were performed with ante-exenteration,two cases were treated with post-exentration.Thirty cases were follwed up for 2-52 months(means 17.1 months).Nineteen cases were healed and eleven cases were recurrent in which three cases died.Conclusion Exenteration is a procedure which was used for orbital malignant tumors and some certain benign tumor.But indications must be handled strictly.Operations and orbital reconstructions should be performed according to patients’ conditions.

CpXa0bEc.title: Experimental study on prevention adhesion after orbital blowout fracture repaired by man-made plates of amniotic membrane
CpXa0bEc.abstract: Objective: To explore the effect of preventing adhesion after the orbital blowout fracture on orbit tissue by amniotic membrane. Design: Experimental study. Participants: Twenty-six New Zealand rabbits. Methods: Establishing rabbit orbital blowout fracture model, the right orbit of twenty rabbits was repaired by hydroxyapatite (HA) parceled of amniotic membrane, and left orbit was only repaired by HA, the orbits of the other six rabbits weren't repaired. Then we got the tissue around bone after one week and one month, and compared the difference of three groups. Main Outcome Measures: Inflammatory response of tissue around bone was analyzed by HE, picric acid Sirius Scarlet dying, TGF-β immunohistochemical observation. Results: One week after operation, HE and immunohistochemistry showed that the difference was not significant in inflammatory response between experimental group and control group (P= 0.351, P=0.413), and difference is significant between blank group and experimental group (P= 0.012, P=0.041). One month after operation, HE and immunohistochemistry showed that the difference was significant in inflammatory response between experimental group and control group(P=0.037, P=0.048), and there is no significant difference between experimental group and blank group(P=0.285, P=0.472). Conclusion: It has an important role of anti-inflammatory, and anti-adhesion in the chronic stage of inflammatory after orbital blowout fracture repaired by man-made plates of amniotic membrane.

QPdRt4sM.title: Intralesional steroid therapy of infantile haemangioma of orbit
QPdRt4sM.abstract: Objective To evaluate the clinical effect of local injection of triamcinolone acetonide and dexamethasone for infamtile hemangiomas of orbit.Methods From February 2002 to January 2006,triamcinolone acetonide and dexamethasone were administered by intralesional injection for 1～4 times in twenty-five patients,and color Doppler imaging(CDI)ultrasound examination was penformed after intralesional injection.Results CDI ultrasonography showed scarce blood flow signals in 18 cases(72%),and decreased blood supply after treatment in 7 cases(28%).Conclusions Intralesional injection of triamcinolone acetonide and dexamethasone is efficacious for treatment of infantile hemangiomas,and no evident side effect was found.

tEmA1Utl.title: Infrequent bilateral orbital tumors and simulating lesions: the experience of a Chinese institute.
tEmA1Utl.abstract: To determine the types, frequency, and clinical features of infrequent bilateral orbital lesions.We reviewed 41 cases of either histopathologically or radiologically verified bilateral orbital lesions. The number and entities in each category were recorded. Clinical data and imaging findings were reviewed.The number and percentage of lesions in each general category were leukemia lesions in eight patients (19.5%), metastatic tumors in seven (17%), optic nerve and meningeal tumors in six (14.6%), secondary tumors in six (14.6%), peripheral nerve lesions in four (9.8%), inflammatory lesions in four (9.8%), and vasculogenic, histiocytic, and miscellaneous lesions, each in two patients (4.9%). These lesions occurred in both childhood and adulthood, but were infrequent in people over 60 years old. Of all cases, 51.2% were benign and 48.8% were malignant. The ocular symptoms and signs presented unilaterally in 18 (43.9%) cases and bilaterally in 23 (56.1%). Of the 15 patients with either metastatic tumors or blood disorders, two (13.3%) had a history of primary neoplasm at presentation. In 19 (46.3%) cases, the configuration of the bilateral lesions was symmetrical, and they were of equal size. Computed tomography scans revealed bone changes in 13 patients (31.7%), while magnetic resonance imaging revealed intracranial extension in nine (22%).Varied lesions can involve the bilateral orbits simultaneously or on follow-up. Through the combination of history, bilateral ocular manifestations, radiologic findings, and systemic examinations, the correct diagnosis can be made, which is valuable for early identification of both metastasis and blood disorders.

k834BaJM.title: Orbital dermoid cyst with sinus tract mimicking ectopic cilia.
k834BaJM.abstract: Dermoid cysts are the most common periorbital masses presenting in childhood. We describe an unusual case of a dermoid cyst presenting with black hairs emerging from a sinus tract on the upper eyelid and mimicking the appearance of ectopic cilia. Our case highlights the value of radiologic examinations in such cases.

p2DwidxD.title: Delayed presentation of grease-gun injury to the orbit.
p2DwidxD.abstract: A 44-year-old man was examined for marked edema and ptosis of the right upper eyelid after grease from high-pressure hydraulic machinery penetrated his right orbit 20 days earlier. The diagnosis of residual grease in the injured orbit was confirmed by CT and MRI, and the clinical presentation. During orbital exploration, the grease was removed completely. Among the wide variety of orbital foreign bodies, grease is rarely reported. We present the sixth case of grease-gun injury to the orbit to be reported in the English language literature since 1964.

GFKaPunV.title: Orbital alveolar soft part sarcoma: A report of 8 cases and review of the literature.
GFKaPunV.abstract: Alveolar soft part sarcoma (ASPS) is a rare soft tissue neoplasm. The incidence of orbital involvement is the highest in ASPS arising in the head and neck region. However, limited information is available regarding its clinical characteristics. The present study presents the clinical manifestations, imaging findings, pathological features, treatment strategies and prognosis records of 8 cases of orbital ASPS over the last 15 years in a single hospital, along with a review of the literature. Included were 3 male and 5 female patients, with the median age at presentation being 9.5 years. The mean average largest tumour diameter was 3.6 cm. A total of 5 patients underwent surgical excision of the tumour, with 2 undergoing orbital exenteration and 1 undergoing partial orbital exenteration. In total, 6 patients received postoperative radiotherapy and 2 received chemotherapy. Upon follow-up, 6 patients were doing well with no evidence of recurrence or metastasis. Local recurrence developed in 2 patients, of whom 1 succumbed following withdrawal from treatment. According to the present series and the cases mentioned in the literature, orbital alveolar soft part sarcoma has characteristics distinct from those of alveolar soft part sarcoma which arises in other locations. Orbital alveolar soft part sarcoma presents itself in a younger population with a shorter course of disease, smaller tumour size, improved prognosis, a marked association with the extraocular muscles and with the Ki-67 proliferation index possibly associated with prognosis of the disease.

nvfG9YAV.title: Analysis of therapeutic effect of fractionated stereotactic radiotherapy for primary optic nerve sheath meningioma
nvfG9YAV.abstract: Objective To assess the efficacy of fractionated stereotactic conformal radiotherapy(SCRT) with target dose of 40Gy using 4Gy/fractionation in patients with primary optic nerve sheath meningioma(ONSM).Methods Between 2004 and 2010, 15 patients(15 eyes) with ONSM were treated by Hyper- SGSI gamma knife treatment system;All patients received SCRT with a median dose of 40 Gy in 10 fractionations.Clinical and radiographic follow- up were performed every 6 months after SCRT therapy,Efficacy of SCRT and improvement of symptoms were evaluated by clinic manifestation and change of tumor maximum diameter in different follow-up time.Results After a median follow-up of 23 months,tumor control rate was 100%(15 cases),the maximum diameter of the tumor was reduced more than 50%in 4patients(26.7%);25%～50%in 6patients(40%);10%～25%in 6 patients (33.46%).Proptosis was improved in all cases(11 cases).The degree of proptosis at pro and post treatment were(17.3±0.8) mm, 14.5±0.3cm respectively,P<0.05.The visual control rate in all patients was 73.3%(11/15);Visual acuity was improved in 2 patients, remained stable in 9 patients,and deteriorated in 2patients,blindness in 2 patients.Reversible conjunctival edema was seen in 10 patients.Conclusions Fractionated stereotactic radiotherapy can improves tumor control and proptosis for ONSM;Control rate for the visual observation is still needed for a long time,The best dose fractionation with SCRT for ONSM was required for further study

irbjfLCs.title: Radiotherapy for orbital rhabdomyosarcoma
irbjfLCs.abstract: Objective To analyze retrospectively the outcome of treating orbital rhabdomyosarcoma with radiotherapy.Methods From December 2002 to May 2008,19 patients(ten males and nine females) aged 5 to 18 with orbital rhabdomyosarcoma received radiotherapy.The media dose was 45 Gy(range,32.4～54 Gy).The media duration of follow - up was 57.7 months(range, 29～98 months).Results The overall survival rate at 3 and 5 years was 89%and 83%.The disease - free survival at 3 and 5 years was 84%and 78%respectively.Treatment failure was shown by local relapse in three patients and distant metastasis in one patient. Conclusions Orbital rhabdomyosarcoma can be cured with radiotherapy.

Ki5hhQig.title: Hyper-SGSI gamma knife in 22 patients with primary optic nerve sheath meningioma
Ki5hhQig.abstract: Objective To assess the efficacy of Hyper-SGSI gamma knife with different dose fractionations in patients with primary optic nerve sheath meningioma(ONSM).Methods From Aug.2004 to Mar.2010,22 patients with ONSM were treated with fractionated stereotactic radiotherapy(FSRT) by Hyper-SGSI gamma knife treatment system.1 case was treated with conventional fractionation,the radiation dose was 50 Gy in 25 fractions;21 patients were treated with hypofraction,the radiation dose were 36-40 Gy in 8-12 fractions.Clinical and radiographic follow-up were performed every 6 months after FSRT therapy,Efficacy of FSRT and improvement of symptoms were evaluated by clinic manifestation and change of tumor maximum diameter in different follow-up time.Results After a median follow-up of 25 months,the visual control rate in all patients was 77.3%(17/22).Visual acuity was improved in 4 patients,remained stable in 13 patients,and deteriorated in 3patients,blindness in 2 patients.The visual control rate would decline with time of follow-up,with one year follow-up was 95.0%(19/20),with two years follow-up was 75.0%(9/12).The tumor control rate was 100.0%(22 cases).The maximum diameter of the tumor was reduced more than 50% in 8 patients(36.4%);25%~50% in 11patients(50.0%);10%~25% in 3 patients(13.6%).The rate of improvement with proptosis was 100.0%(17/17).The degree of proptosis at pro and post treatment were(17.3±2.7)mm and(14.9±1.5)mm,respectively.There were statistical significance(P<0.05).Ten cases with reversible complications could be recovered after symptomatic treatment.Conclusion Fractionated stereotactic radiotherapy can improves tumor control and proptosis for ONSM,while control rate for the visual observation is still needed for a long time.The best dose fractionation with FSRT for ONSM will be required for further study.

Ano9YQYT.title: [Endoscopic transethmoidal resection of medial orbital lesions].
Ano9YQYT.abstract: The endoscopic transethmoidal approach is a useful approach for cavernous hemangiomas, schwannoma or dermoid cyst located medially to the optic nerve in the middle or posterior orbit. It's safer for the tumor located medially to the muscle cone than in the cone. It's an important surgical skill to reduce the complications that intraorbital dissection and exposure of tumors in the cone are assisted with a mini caruncula incision.

90Cih39t.title: An insight into endoscopic transethmoidal resection of intraorbital tumors
90Cih39t.abstract: This study aims to evaluate indications, complications and surgical technique in the endonasal endoscopic approach to orbital tumor resection. In this retrospective review, 11 patients who admitted and underwent endoscopic orbital surgery were reviewed. Demographics, preoperative and postoperative eye examination, and size and imaging characteristics of the tumours were tabulated. The endonasal approach was selected for tumors located nasal to optic nerve and in medial-inferior orbit to orbital apex. Under general anaesthesia, ethmoidotomy was performed with the aid of endonasal endoscope. The lamina papyracea was then fenestrated and through that opening, the intraorbital tumor was isolated and removed. If necessary, an auxiliary transcaruncular incision was made to facilitate the exposure. An en bloc removal of tumors was achieved in all cases. Pathological examination has confirmed that 9 patients had cavernous haemangioma, 1 patient had schwannoma and 1 had dermoid cyst. The dimension of tumors ranged from 15 × 12 × 10 mm3 to 24 × 23 × 16 mm3. Four tumours were located nasal to the muscular cone and 5 tumors were in the muscle cone, 1 tumor in the medial rectus. After operation, the best-corrected visual acuity improved in 3 patients, with a full recovery of visual field defects. Two patients had impaired visual acuity. Three patients had transient limitation of ocular movements. Abduction and adduction remain restricted in 1 case, respectively. Combination of endonasal endoscopy and orbital surgery technique can improve safety and efficacy in the transethmoidal resection of medial or inferior orbital tumours or orbital apex tumours.

ITfgMBUe.title: Orbital tumor in old age:a clinical study on 234 patients
ITfgMBUe.abstract: Objective:To investigate the classification and distribution of orbital tumors in old age.Methods:A retrospective review of 234 patients with orbital tumor identified by pathological examination at Armed Police General Hospital of Beijing from October 1,2003 to October 1,2008.the number and percentage of benign and malignant tumors were accounted.The most common tumors in different age groups were determined.Results:Benign orbital tumors were 59.4%.The 3 leading benign orbital tumors were the vascular tumors,the orbital inflammation and the neurogenic tumors.Malignant orbital tumors were 40.6%.The top 3 malignant tumors were malignant lymphoma,secondary tumors and malignant lacrimal gland epithelial tumors.Cavernous hemangioma and orbital inflammation were the most common benign tumors respectively of two age groups of 60-70 years and more 70 years.Malignant lymphoma was the most common malignant tumor in two age groups.Conclusion:The percentage of malignant tumors raise up in old age.Malignant lymphoma is the most common malignant tumor,which increased with age.

0RWnn490.title: Major Factors Analysis on Controlling the Formation of Favorable Reservoir in Deep Level of Bohai Bay Basin
0RWnn490.abstract: Main controlling factors for the development of deep buried reservoirs in the Bohai Bay basin are discussed on sedimentation, diagenesis and other related factors. Besides the influence of sedimentation, low geothermic gradient, high deposition rate, high heating rate, high hydrocarbon generation intensity and overpressure are main factors for the formation of anomaly high porosity intervals in deep buried reservoirs of the Bohai Bay basin, because they affected the course and intensity of diagenesis. The relatively high porosity and high permeability intervals were best developed in the Huanghua depression, and second in the Liaohe depression, and worst in the Jizhong depression.

qCGc4BMF.title: SIMULATION OF DIAGENETIC HISTORY AND PREDICTION OF DIAGENETIC STAGES: TAKING CARBONATES IN HUANGHUA DEPRESSION AS AN EXAMPLE
qCGc4BMF.abstract: A numerical simulation system of carbonate diagenesis is built through modeling variations of vitrinite reflectance (R_o), palaeogeothermal, content of smectite in I/S mixed layers and sterane C_ 29S/R+S in time and space. Simulation results indicate that the Ordovician carbonates were in the early diagentic stage during the Caledonian epoch, and were in the middle diagenetic stage A from the Hercynianin epoch to the Indo-Chinese epoch,and entered the middle diagenetic stage B in the Yanshan epoch. From Paleogene till present, the carbonates in the lower interval of Ordovician have been in the late diagenetic stage, but the carbonates in the middle and upper intervals of Ordovician were still in the middle diagenetic stage. At present, the Ordovician carbonates are in the middle diagenetic stage B in the southern and northern Huanghua depression, which is favorable for generation and accumulation of natural gas. While the Ordovician carbonates are in the middle diagenetic stage A in the middle part of the Huanghua depression, which is favorable for generation and accumulation of liquid hydrocarbons, thus this area is favorable for oil exploration.

ROnvC53n.title: Mechanisms for Retardation of Mechanical Compaction by Overpressures and its Application
ROnvC53n.abstract: The relationship between effective burial depth and overpressure is deduced on the pressure balance principle,and a new model of reservoir porosity prediction is developed.As the result shows,1 MPa of overpressure in reservoirs can decrease 41.82m effective burial depth;the precision of our porosity prediction model is higher than that of Gluyas' model(1997).The model developed could be applied to the reservoir porosity predictions of frontier basins.

5AGK3EsC.title: Diagenetic facies analysis and high quality reservoir prediction of the Cenozoic in southern segment of western slope of Liaohe Depression
5AGK3EsC.abstract: The analyses of measured porosity data,thin sections,casting thin sections and scanning electronic microscopes of the reservoirs indicate that three secondary porosity zones were vertically developed in the Cenozoic reservoirs of the southern segment of the western slope of the Liaohe Depression in the Bohaiwan Basin.As a result,the high quality reservoirs are developed in a generally low porosity and permeability background.Sedimentary microfacies and diagenesis are the main factors controlling the formation and distribution of the high quality reservoirs which were mainly developed as braided channel,mouth-bar and sheet-like sand microfacies.They belong to the early diagenetic stage B to intermediate diagenetic stage A1 and dissolution diagenetic facies were developed.The diagenetic stages and diagenetic facies distribution are predicted by simulating the paleotemperature,vitrinite reflectance,sterane isomerization rate and authigenetic quartz variation in space and time.The distribution of high quality reservoirs of Member 3 of Shahejie Formation is predicted by superimposing the diagenetic facies maps on the microfacies maps.The results show that the high-quality reservoirs of Member 3 of Shahejie Formation were developed in the middle part of the western slope.

RdUFeWYz.title: A discussion on factors to control porosity of deep-buried clastic reservoirs in the northern Bohai Bay basin
RdUFeWYz.abstract: The factors to control porosity of deep-buried (>3500 m) clastic reservoirs are discussed in the northern Bohai Bay basin, resulting in several conclusions. These deep-buried reservoirs' petrophysical property is still controlled by their sedimentary facies, and the sandbodies of fluvial and delta facies are still higher in porosity after their later modification. In depressions with high potential of hydrocarbon generation, secondary porosity is relatively developed in reservoirs because large amounts of organic acids are expelled from source rocks. The high rate of heating is favorable to early generation, expulsion and charge of hydrocarbon, which may inhibit cementation and maintain porosity in reservoirs. Overpressures may play a role in protection of reservoir porosity because they can increase active energy of chemical reactions, retard generation and expulsion of organic acids from source rocks and solution of reservoirs, and decrease effects of mechanical compaction on reservoir porosity.

9DrKKZgf.title: Meng YL,Xiao LH,Luo XY,Yin XL,Cheng KM and Wang ZG.2005.Time and space domains of hydrocarbon migration and accumulation in the Ordovician carbonates of the Huanghua depression.
9DrKKZgf.abstract: Only the traps developed before or at the same time of hydrocarbon migration could be charged by hydrocarbons and formed reservoirs.To determine the time and space domains of hydrocarbon migration and accumulation in the Ordovician carbonates of the Huanghua depression in the Bohaiwan basin,China,the homogenization temperature of the fluid inclusions and K/Ar isotopic ages of the autogenous illites were measured,and the structural developing history,the thermal history,hydrocarbon generation history and migration history of the depression were analyzed.Then the mathematical statistics of hydrocarbon migration times corresponding to the homogenization temperature of the fluid inclusions in the different stages of all the samples was carried out to avoid the uncertainty of the migration times.As the results show,the hydrocarbon migration and accumulation in the Huanghua depression took place in Indosinian epoch,Yanshan epoch and Himalayan epoch.The distribution areas of organic fluid inclusions showed the areas of the hydrocarbon migration and accumulation.The hydrocarbon migration area in the Indosinian epoch (T_3) was in the southwestern Huanghua depression,then expanded to the eastern boundary of the depression during the Yanshan epoch (K_1-K_2),and finally reached the northern Huanghua depression in the Himalayan epoch (E_2-N_1).The petroleum exploration of the Ordovieian carbonates should have been focused on the traps in the southwestern Huanghua depression that formed in the Indosinian epoch and haven't been destroyed by later structural movements.

772dr4qn.title: Oil and Gas Accumulation History Using Fluid Inclusions and Basin Modeling-Example from the Western Slope of the Yuanyanggou Sub-Sag
772dr4qn.abstract: Defining the hydrocarbon migration period and the path is a key to the analysis of oil and gas reservoir.The time and space distribution characteristics of hydrocarbon migration and the accumulation kinetics of the western slope of Yuanyanggou sub-sag are determined,through homogenization temperatures of fluid inclusions,simulation and paleo-geothermal history and petroleum inclusions particles index GOI statistics.The results show that the Hydrocarbon migration times of the western slope of the Yuanyanggou sub-sag are Ed2,Ed1 and Nm,of which the Ed2 and Ed1 are two main stages.A basin modeling study further shows that the Shahejie Group began to produce oil at the end of Es1,but large-scale oil and gas expulsion and accumulation started during the Ed period.The statistical and analysis indicate that the high-value areas of GOI(GOI>5%) is favorable areas for hydrocarbon accumulation,and Huanxiling and Shuangnan oilfields are in the GOI>5% region.A perfect time and space distribution characteristics of hydrocarbon migration may be determined by the information from enclosure and basin modelling.

NPDjyjoq.title: Diagenetic Facies Analysis and Anomalously High Porosity Zone Prediction of the Yuanyanggou Area in the Liaohe Depression
NPDjyjoq.abstract: The measured porosity data and the observations of the thin sections and blue epoxy resin-impregnated thin sections show that there exist three anomalously high porosity zones vertically in the Cenozoic reservoirs in the Yuanyanggou area,Liaohe Depression,Bohaiwan Basin.To predict the lateral distribution of anomalously high porosity zones,the diagenetic stages and diagenetic facies has been predicted by digital modeling of the diagenetic parameters,e.g. paleotemperature,vitrinite reflectance,sterane isomerization rate,smectite and authigenetic quartz concentrations in space-time,respectively.The chosen diagenetic parameters are sensitive to diagenesis and applied to divide diagenetic stages(commonly.) The anomalously high porosity zones are dominantly formed in the channel mouth bar,(braided) channel and channel bar deposits in the early diagenetic stage B period to late diagenetic stage A_1(period,) and developed dissolution diagenetic facieses.Therefore,the anomalously high porosity zones in the(reservoirs) could be blocked out by superposing the diagenetic facies maps on the microfacies maps.The anomalously high porosity zone of the Shasan member is mainly located in the middle slope part of the Yuanyanggou area, and extends along the western slope of the Liaohe Depression.

cla3ZTnE.title: Predicting reservoir porosity by Time-Depth Index:a case study on Es3m in the southern Xibu sag,Liaohe depression
cla3ZTnE.abstract: Based on the reservoir porosity prediction method by Time-Depth Index(TDI) introduced by Sombra and Kiang,a sequence stratigraphy study and a sedimentary facies analysis,a correlation model between TDI and measured porosity has been built for various microfacies of the middle Third Member of Shahejie Formation(Es3m) in the southern Xibu sag,Liaohe depression.The TDIs of various microfacies are calculated by seismic data.This approach has resulted in prediction of reservoir porosity for Es3m.By comparison with the measured downhole porosity data,it is suggested that this approach can be used to predict porosity for reservoir with pore-filled cements great than 10% in an area with sparse drilling data.In addition,the TDI calculation for overpressured reservoir is discussed in order to extend the application of this approach.

1TkXmgZt.title: Controls of the fan-delta sedimentary microfacies on the diagenesis in the south of western Liaohe Depression, Bohai Bay Basin
1TkXmgZt.abstract: The controls of the sedimentary microfacies of fan-delta on the diagenesis in the south of the western Liaohe Depression, Bohai Bay Basin are discussed by using measured porosity data, thin sections, blue epoxy resin-impregnated thin sections, SEM, and XRD. The results show that the mineral comparative maturity of sandstones increases with the distance from the fan-delta plain to the fan-delta front; of all kinds of sandstones in the fan-delta microfacies, channel mouth bars have undergone the most intensive dissolution, secondary pores are well developed, and the diagenesis of the braided channel and channel bar sandstones is dominated by compaction and the diagenesis of the channel mouth bar and marsh sandstones is dominated by cementation. The cementation materials of the sandstones in the marsh and profan-delta are mainly calcites (carbonates), while the interstitial materials of channel mouth bar, channel bar and braided channel deposits are mainly clay. The sedimentary microfacies of the fan-delta have significant controls on the diagenesis and mineral components of clastic reservoirs.
